desc: This shows the average age of a reserve currency before it loses its reign. Bitcoin is inevitable!

msgs.text: This shows the average age of a reserve currency before it loses its reign. Bitcoin is inevitable!
This shows the price action throughout the Bitcoin halvings (cycles). Look at the similarities. We are currently in the 4th Epoch (rightmost light blue section)...
Yearly lows. All time highs followed by tremendous price crashes are misleading! Zoom out!
Exponential growth of Bitcoin's Lightning Network over the past year. For more, see: <#874338300721250324>
The rate at which the Federal Reserve is printing money is exponential. Bitcoin fixes this

One of the most interesting ways to visualize bitcoin's adoption is via a polar coordinates chart, such as @clockwork_parts has done. 

The logarithmic radius represents bitcoin's price, while the angle represents time.

The price of the US Dollar is spiraling into the Bitcoin's gravitational black hole of value (the spiral is getting tighter/smaller)! Where does it look to be headed?! 1 sat = $1???

Bitcoin energy use compared to other industries. Bitcoin's carbon intensity is lower and predicted to be zero CO2 per kWh by 2031. Maybe, finally, we‚Äôll be done with this debate. If you're more curious on Bitcoin's energy consumption, see: https://discord.com/channels/874318808423219280/874319558641610802/874955308580098058
Another look at price action after a Bitcoin halving. We are the green line...look what's next (probabilistically)!
Solid proof that more and more and More and MORE fiat money is to be printed
Chart showing Bitcoin's supply rate going down while fiat currency debasing more and more
One of Satoshi's wallets for your viewing pleasure. Note that 0 Bitcoin have moved from it. Link: https://bitinfocharts.com/bitcoin/address/1FeexV6bAHb8ybZjqQMjJrcCrHGW9sb6uF
Technology adoption in the US. Bitcoin is bottom right...still early!!

Chart of Bitcoin wallet supply distribution. You might do some quick math and panic that there is a large percentage of to total supply held by the top 1% of addresses. But panic not, most of the top addresses are represented by massive exchanges which are responsible for thousands if not millions of people. 
Link including top 100 wallet addresses as well as top dormant addresses: 
https://bitinfocharts.com/top-100-richest-bitcoin-addresses.html

As shown in the chart, whales (Bitcoin holders with 1000 BTC or more) hold only 25% of the total supply, and that number is dropping rapidly. 37% hold 10-100 BTC and 14% hold <10 BTC. This data is from August, 2021.

Here is another, more detailed breakdown of the Bitcoin supply. This data is however, is a bit older (February, 2021). As you can see, the Whale/Humpback total was recently way more than 25%. Whales, fish, supply breakdown
<@!392828783243296769> have a look at this one will ya

PlanB's Bitcoin "Stock-to-Flow" model. Many praise this for being an accurate indicator of price in Bitcoin's history so far. It basically maps price as result of Bitcoin's diminishing and limited supply (scarcity). More on his model here: https://medium.com/@100trillionUSD/modeling-bitcoins-value-with-scarcity-91fa0fc03e25
Purchasing power of the US dollar

The Realized Price is the value of all the coins at the price they were bought divided by the amount of Bitcoin that is in circulation (doesn't include stagnant coins). This means that people are paying as much for a Bitcoin right now as they did back in May. This is bullish news!!
Monetary Base and Consumer Price Index. Bitcoin fixes this

The Chainalysis 2021 Global Crypto Adoption Index -
Top 20 countries, based on three metrics: Total crypto activity, trading activity of non-professional users, and peer-to-peer exchange trade volume. All are weighted by purchasing power parity per capita.
More on this chart: https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/18/new-cryptocurrency-bitcoin-user-global-map.html

Bitcoin fixes war. "We can win a major battle in the arms race and gain a new territory of freedom for several years." - Satoshi‚Äôs reply to a lengthy exposition of a vulnerability by a user, accompanied by the text ‚ÄúYou will not find a solution to political problems in cryptography‚Äù.

Another look at the Bitcoin price graphed with polar coordinates.

As the mining reward halves every 4 years, some people wonder how the miners will be incentivized to secure the network in say, 50 years from now. This graph estimates the year (around 2034) when transaction fees from the network will eventually be high enough to outweigh the mining reward enough to encourage miners to keep securing the network.
Fidelity 100MM Bitcoin by 2035. For better viewing, click picture then click on the bottom left "Open original"

The volume of #Bitcoin younger than 1 month has hit an all-time-low of less than 7% of circ. supply.

In other-words, the volume of coins older than 1 month is at an all-time-high.

The HODL is very real
Old coins are not being spent
Young coins are maturing

This is bullish.

The *Real* Bitcoin Dominance Index is 92.50% if you disregard POS shitcoins (incl. ETH).

The Real Bitcoin Dominance Index only includes coins using proof-of-work that are attempting to be money. It does not include ICOs or stablecoins.
That seems like an arbitrary metric.
though I suppose it could be useful if you are, for some reason, specifically concerned with the market cap of POW coins
Well the idea is that PoS coins can't be money
That's certainly an idea. I imagine most POW blockchains can't be money either.

Blue dots in spiral are the ATH's. Chart on the right is zooming in on those blue dots. The force behind current cycle is stronger than 2017. Continuing the trajectory we might reach prices between 142k and 392k, with the first half of that range having a higher likelihood.

Average daily transaction fees: $600,000.

Game over banks.

Black: S2F

Bitcoin realized price is the average price at which each Bitcoin moved the last time in the network. It is the average value that investors have assigned to BTC based on on-chain movement. Shows #Bitcoin's growth while reducing the effect of large spikes in value. #bitcoin

M1 is the¬†money supply¬†that is composed of physical currency and coin, demand deposits, travelers' checks, other checkable deposits, and negotiable order of withdrawal (NOW) accounts. M1 includes the most liquid portions of the money supply because it contains currency and assets that either are or can be quickly converted to cash. However, "near money" and "near, near money," which fall under M2 and M3, cannot be converted to currency as quickly.

Comparing now to gold's volatility in the early 1900s. Hyperinflation affected the German Papiermark, the currency of the Weimar Republic, between 1921 and 1923, primarily in 1923. Supply distribution based on price sold.

It is the percentage of the entire BTC supply that has been last sold at that specific price bucket. 

So if someone bought their BTC at 69k, it will be in the 69k bucket. If they sell it to someone else for 40k, it will be removed from the 69k bar and added to 40k bar.

BTC/XLE
The price of Bitcoin is really the price of energy to create it. A good proxy for energy price is XLE.

They are correlated most of the time.

When the correlation breaks down then Bitcoin is either over or undervalued at that particular time and a reversion usually occurs
